definition:
Predestinated; foreordained; fated. "A predestinate scratched face." Shak.

To predetermine or foreordain; to appoint or ordain beforehand by an unchangeable purpose or decree; to preÃ«lect. Whom he did foreknow, he also did predestinate to be conformed to the image of his Son. Rom. viii. 29. Syn. -- To predetermine; foreordain; preordain; decree; predestine; foredoom.
